t: Isaiah 24
The Earth Judged
Look,*pn the Lord*s is stripping the earth bare and*ln making it desolate. He*ln will twist its surface and scatter its inhabitants:
people*ln and priest alike, servant*ln and master, female*ln servant and mistress, buyer*ln and seller, lender*ln and borrower, creditor*ln and debtor.
The*ln earth will be stripped completely bare and*ln will be totally plundered, for*ln the Lord*s has spoken this message.
The*ln earth mourns and withers; the*ln world wastes away and withers; the*ln exalted people of the earth waste away.
The*ln earth is polluted by its inhabitants, for*ln they have transgressed teachings, overstepped*ln decrees, and*ln broken the permanent covenant.
Therefore*ln a curse has consumed the earth, and*ln its inhabitants have become guilty; the*ln earth’s inhabitants have been burned, and*ln only a few survive.
The*ln new wine mourns; the*ln vine withers. All*ln the carousers now groan.
The*ln joyful tambourines have ceased. The*ln noise of the jubilant has stopped. The*ln joyful lyre has ceased.
They*ln no longer sing and drink wine; beer*ln is bitter to those who drink it.
The*ln city of chaos is shattered; every*ln house is closed to entry.
In*ln the streets they cry for wine. All*ln joy grows dark; earth’s*ln rejoicing goes into exile.
Only*ln desolation remains in the city; its*ln gate has collapsed in ruins.
For*ln this is how it will be on earth among*ln the nations: like*ln a harvested olive tree, like*ln a gleaning after a grape harvest.
They*ln raise their voices, they sing out; they*ln proclaim in the west the*ln majesty of the Lord.*s
Therefore,*ln in the east honor the Lord!*s In*ln the coasts and islands of the west honor*ln the name of the Lord,*s the*ln God of Israel.

From*ln the ends of the earth we hear songs: The*ln Splendor of the Righteous One. But*ln I said, “I waste away! I waste away! Woe*ln is me.” The*ln treacherous act treacherously; the*ln treacherous deal very treacherously.
Panic,*pn pit, and trap await you who*ln dwell on the earth.

Whoever*ln flees at the sound of panic will*ln fall into a pit, and*ln whoever escapes from the pit will*ln be caught in a trap. For*ln the floodgates on high are opened, and*ln the foundations of the earth are shaken.
The*ln earth is completely devastated; the*ln earth is split open; the*ln earth is violently shaken.
The*ln earth staggers like a drunkard and*ln sways like a hut. Earth’s*ln rebellion weighs it down, and*ln it falls, never to rise again.
On*pn that day the Lord*s will punish the*ln army of the heights in the heights and*ln the kings of the ground on the ground.
They*ln will be gathered together like*ln prisoners in a pit. They*ln will be confined to a dungeon; after*ln many days they will be punished.

The*ln moon will be put to shame and*ln the sun disgraced, because*ln the Lord*s of Armies will reign as king on*ln Mount Zion in Jerusalem, and*ln he will display his glory in*ln the presence of his elders.
